portfolio.title: Portfolio
portfolio.intro: Exploring the intersection of natural materials and contemporary art through textile installations and sculptural forms.

funguy.title: Fun-guy
funguy.description: An installation consisting of four light objects. Each object functions both as an independent artwork and a functional light fixture. Each individual object measures 150x30x30cm. The illuminated, brownish translucent part - the "lampshade" is made using cellulose fiber grown by the author using symbiotic bacterial culture.

rainbow.title: Varav카ksnene
rainbow.description: Located in the middle of the exhibition, this object made of wool, polyester, and composite materials features a rainbow-colored eye observing the space. It challenges viewers to contemplate how differently each person might perceive the same view.

biography.title: Biography
biography.intro: Based in Riga, Latvia, I am a textile artist known for my work in textiles and installation art, exploring the intersection of traditional techniques and contemporary themes.

background.title: Background and Early Career
background.content: Known professionally as both Ilze Brenn and Ilze Erba-Brenholma, I studied at the Art Academy of Latvia, where I developed my unique approach to textile art combining traditional craftsmanship with contemporary artistic expression.

exhibitions.title: Notable Exhibition (2019)
exhibitions.content: A significant milestone in my career was the exhibition 'Studentu dienasgr훮matas III. Tekstils' (Students' Journals III. Textile) from March 2 to April 22, 2019. My installation 'Ciklisk훮 diagon훮le' transformed clothing with gender role stereotypes into an abstract form using digital weaving, batik, and embroidery techniques.

workshops.title: Workshops and Public Engagement
workshops.content: I actively engage with the art community through open workshops on digital embroidery, sharing my expertise and techniques with aspiring artists and enthusiasts.

current.title: Current Focus
current.content: I remain active in Latvia's art scene, continuing to explore the boundaries between traditional textiles and contemporary art while addressing important social themes through my work.
